channel.title: Declaring animation types [SOLVED]
channel.description:
[u]First of all, Hello Moparscape and thank you for providing this bastion of information.[/u]
While browsing through the files for EasyRSC I noticed that the sprites for the hatchet had been changed (from the battleaxe sprite to a new one). I decided to mock up a quick edit on the shield sprites into a shield that looks somewhat like a kite-shield.
I came here because I wanted to know how I can add these to my client. I have my item and itemwieldable xml files correct, however, I noticed in the animaton xml file it names each entry. For example, all the woodcutting axes have a name of "hatchet", the battle axes have a name of "battleaxe", the wizardhat, gnomehat, etc, have a name of "wizardhat".
I'm probably way off but my assumption is that these names are storing information about which sprite files to use for the item/npc/etc. I have searched through both client and server text files and I see no reference to these names anywhere, nor do I see any related references to item ID's in any of the files.
[center]Thank you in advance, imALLin[/center]
Update:
Figured it out, there seems to be a lack of information about this so I will post a tutorial within a day or two.

item.title: Declaring animation types [SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @imALLin imALLin
item.description:
@imALLin wrote:

First of all, Hello Moparscape and thank you for providing this bastion of information.

While browsing through the files for EasyRSC I noticed that the sprites for the hatchet had been changed (from the battleaxe sprite to a new one).
I decided to mock up a quick edit on the shield sprites into a shield that looks somewhat like a kite-shield.

I came here because I wanted to know how I can add these to my client. I have my item and itemwieldable xml files correct, however, I noticed in the animaton xml file it names each entry. For example, all the woodcutting axes have a name of “hatchet”, the battle axes have a name of “battleaxe”, the wizardhat, gnomehat, etc, have a name of “wizardhat”.

I’m probably way off but my assumption is that these names are storing information about which sprite files to use for the item/npc/etc. I have searched through both client and server text files and I see no reference to these names anywhere, nor do I see any related references to item ID’s in any of the files.

[center]Thank you in advance,
imALLin[/center]

Update:

Figured it out, there seems to be a lack of information about this so I will post a tutorial within a day or two.
